With #BetterWay agenda, my House GOP colleagues & I are ready to hit the ground running, shake up D.C., get our country back on track
A Better Way addresses some of the biggest challenges we face, from restoring the people’s voice, to repealing and replacing Obamacare.
A year ago, House Republicans set out to create a bold, specific agenda by listening to people in every corner of America.
Our unified Republican government will work together to change the status quo and create real progress for the American people.
The #REINSAct guarantees approval by the people's representatives for expensive rules & regulations coming from federal bureaucrats.
My House GOP colleagues & I are hitting the ground running to hold the executive branch accountable for expensive rules and regulations.
Accountability in our federal government is a must. That's why I'm working to bring the people back to the center of their government.
This week, my House GOP colleagues & I are continuing efforts to cut down on unnecessary regulation and government-knows-best policies.

This is in addition to HR 3538 which I sponsored - would require a NWS Doppler radar facility in any metro area of 700k or more.
Yesterday in the House, I requested appropriations to study radar coverage gaps in major metropolitan areas.
Inadequate radar coverage results in missed signs of severe weather, such as a 2012 CLT tornado for which warning was received after damage.
The Doppler radar covering CLT is in Greenville/Spartanburg - a signal too weak for accurate coverage once it reaches CLT.
Did you know that CLT is the largest metropolitan area without a  NWS Doppler Radar Facility? I'm working to change that.
